info.description: Provisioning and deletion of services (CD fixed)
info.title: Service provisioning (CD fixed)

tags.name: Service Intents
tags.description: Creation, deletion and retrieval of intended L0 (CD Fixed) services<p/>    This non-versioned API is meant for use by an end-user as a pass-through to the latest version.WARNING - backwards compatibility is not guaranteed for non-versioned APIs.

tags.name: Service Intents v1
tags.description: Creation, deletion and retrieval of intended L0 (CD Fixed) services (version 1)

tags.name: Service Intents v2
tags.description: Creation, deletion and retrieval of intended L0 (CD Fixed) services (version 2)

get.description:
Gets all Service Intents currently stored in the database.

Prerequisite: At least one Service Intent must exist.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: (Optional) Retrieve service intents with the specified service user label

parameters.name: layerRates
parameters.description: (Optional) Retrieve service intents that operate at the given layer rate(s)

parameters.name: roadmLineName
parameters.description: (Optional) Retrieve service intents that utilize the named ROADM Line

parameters.name: supportingServiceName
parameters.description: (Optional) Retrieve all client service intents for the specified supporting (infrastructure) service name

post.description:
This API validates intent attributes, computes a path and schedules intent realization for deployment.

Prerequisite: The entered Service Intent is valid.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Intent as a JSON Profile wrapper object

201.description: Intent is created, realized and scheduled

delete.summary: For INTERNAL USE ONLY: Deletes a Service Intent based on its identifier from IFD DB only
delete.description:
This API deletes service Intent based on ID.

Prerequisite: A Service Intent must exist with the given ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the service intent

get.summary: Get a Service Intent based on its identifier
get.description:
This API retrieves an Intent based on ID.

Prerequisite: A Service Intent must exist with the given ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the service intent

delete.summary: Delete a Service Intent based on its identifier
delete.description:
This API deletes an Intent based on ID.

Prerequisite: A Service Intent must exist with the given ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the service intent

post.summary: Not Supported - Deploy a Service Intent based on its identifier
post.description:
This API deploys a created service intent based on ID.

Prerequisite: A Service Intent must exist with the given ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the service intent

post.summary: Force State the Service Intent based on its identifier
post.description:
This API switches the service intent to FAILED_ACTIVATING/FAILED_DEACTIVATING from ACTIVATING/DEACTIVATING respectively based on ID.

Prerequisite: A Service Intent must exist with the given ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the service intent

post.summary: Not Supported - Realign Service Intent based on its identifier
post.description:
This API will realign service intent state to its resource trackers states in case where service intent is in ACTIVATING state but all intent resource trackers are ACTIVATED.Similarly, intent state is in DEACTIVATING state but all intent resource trackers are DEACTIVATED.

Prerequisite: A Service Intent must exist with the given ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the service intent

get.summary: Get Service Intent Resource Trackers based on its identifier
get.description:
This API retrieves all resource trackers based on ID.

Prerequisite: A Service Intent must exist with the given ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the service intent

get.summary: Get Service Intent Route based on its identifier
get.description:
This API retrieves a Route based on ID.

Prerequisite: A Service Intent must exist with the given ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the service intent

post.summary: Begins undeployment of a service intent based on its identifier
post.description:
This API undeploys a service based on ID.

Prerequisite: A Service Intent must exist with the given ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the service intent

parameters.name: ignoreClientServiceDependencies
parameters.description: (Optional. Demo Only - not officially supported) Bypasses service provisioning client service validation if set to true

202.description: Intent found and undeployment will begin

put.summary: Updates a Service Intent based on its identifier
put.description:
This API modifies an existing service intent based on ID.

Prerequisite: A Service Intent must exist with the given ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the service intent

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Intent with the fields to be updated

parameters.name: label

parameters.name: layerRates

delete.summary: For INTERNAL USE ONLY: Deletes a Service Intent based on its identifier from IFD DB only
delete.description:
This API deletes service Intent based on ID.

Prerequisite: A Service Intent must exist with the given ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the service intent

post.description:
This API returns a feasible route based on provided input parameters, but does not persist the route.

Prerequisite: The entered input is valid (including checks such as that the label must be unique).

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Inputs as a JSON Profile wrapper object

200.description: Feasibility check has completed without error

adaptsToLayerRateQualifier.description: Provides a means to provide additional qualification attributes for a Layer Rate. For example, for beyond 100G rates OTUCn and ODUCn, the value of n, where n is a multiple of 100. For example, for beyond 100G rates with sub rate potential (i.e. OTUCn-M), this includes the n-M options where n is the number of OxUC overhead instances and M is the number of 5G tributary slots. For example, OTUC4-60 implies 4 instances of OxUC overhead, and 300G capacity (5G x 60).

cardinality.description: Number of possible potential TPEs. Can be a numeric (eg '1', '96', '1000', ...) or can be categorical (eg 'indirect').

clientTpeRulesInOwnLayer.description: Directions of how to instantiate client TPE(s) for this access point, including indirect (client over client) client TPE instantiation.

lifeCycleRules.description: Indicates the life cycle rules for an entity.

regenIdPackage.description: This package stores regen related information.

cascadedDtlTpePackage.description: This package stores cascaded dtl tpe information.

name.description: Name of the AdaptationPool. Unique in the scope of this TPE.

logicalRule.description: Restrict the number of active poolAdapters could be xOR or OR - default is OR

memberAdaptationPools.description: Reference(s) to 0 or more member AdaptationPool-s. Allows for nesting of AdaptationPools.

namingRules.description: Various miscellaneous attributes that do not necessarily belong in the parent resource. Attributes are populated dynamically and therefore cannot be documented here.

name.description: Name of the Adapter. Unique in the scope of this TPE.

adaptsToLayerRateQualifier.description: Provides a means to provide additional qualification attributes for a Layer Rate. For example, for beyond 100G rates OTUCn and ODUCn, the value of n, where n is a multiple of 100. For example, for beyond 100G rates with sub rate potential (i.e. OTUCn-M), this includes the n-M options where n is the number of OxUC overhead instances and M is the number of 5G tributary slots. For example, OTUC4-60 implies 4 instances of OxUC overhead, and 300G capacity (5G x 60).

connectionRulesInAdaptationLayer.description: Directions of how to instantiate client TPE(s) for this adapter, including indirect (client over client) client TPE instantiation.

cardinality.description: Number of possible potential TPEs. Can be a numeric (eg '1', '96', '1000', ...) or can be categorical (eg 'indirect').

continuousAdapterRulesPackage.description: This package stores various rules to be considered when instantiating a new TPE utilizing continuous b/w.

mappingInteractionRules.description: The specification of the interaction between the support for different client layer protocols signals.

potentialAdapterCapacities.description: Total potential capacity of this Adapter.

lifeCycleRules.description: Indicates the life cycle rules for an entity.

photonicSpectrumPackage.description: This package stores photonic spectrum information.

eFreTerminationState.description: Values to handle TPEs that have multiple poolAdapters, especially multiple poolAdapters adapting to the same layer rate

additionalAttributes.description: Various miscellaneous attributes that do not necessarily belong in the parent resource. Attributes are populated dynamically and therefore cannot be documented here.

adjacencyType.description: This field delimits the adjacency type between two network elements (Ex: LIM, LINE, etc...).

localTag.description: The actual tag of the originating network element.

localTagFormat.description: The format of the local adjacency tag.

provisionedRemoteTag.description: The provisioned remote tag is the expected destination defined by the user that adheres to the remoteTagFormat.

provisionedRemoteTagFormat.description: The format of the remote provisioning adjacency tag.

remoteTag.description: The actual remote tag as discovered by the network element.

remoteTagFormat.description: The format of the remote adjacency tag.

topologySourceTag.description: The tag representing the topological state. This could be 'DISCOVERED', for example.

adjacencyMechanism.description: The attribute defining the adjacency mechanism used.

linkAttributes.description: This package stores information of Link.

configured.description: true/false depending on if nbr is added as route reflector client for afi and safi

excludeReflectedRoutes.description: true/false depending on if nbr is added as route reflector client for afi and safi

ODU0.description: The Bandwidth Threshold shows the maximum number of bandwidth units (here unit of ODU0) advertised for a link.

ODU1.description: The Bandwidth Threshold shows the maximum number of bandwidth units (here unit of ODU1) advertised for a link.

ODU2.description: The Bandwidth Threshold shows the maximum number of bandwidth units (here unit of ODU2) advertised for a link.

ODU2E.description: The Bandwidth Threshold shows the maximum number of bandwidth units (here unit of ODU2E) advertised for a link.

ODU3.description: The Bandwidth Threshold shows the maximum number of bandwidth units (here unit of ODU3) advertised for a link.

ODU4.description: The Bandwidth Threshold shows the maximum number of bandwidth units (here unit of ODU4) advertised for a link.

ODUFLEXRSZ.description: The Bandwidth Threshold shows the maximum number of bandwidth units (in Bps) for Resizable ODU Flex advertised for a link.

ODUFLEXNRSZ.description: The Bandwidth Threshold shows the maximum number of bandwidth units (in Bps) for Non-Resizable ODU Flex advertised for a link.

bfdType.description: Type of BFD - ipBFD, mplsBFD or bgpBFD

configured.description: True when BFD is enabled on this endpoint

profileName.description: The profile name associated with this set of BFD attributes

adminState.description: The administrative state of BFD for this endpoint

operationalState.description: The operational state of BFD for this endpoint

role.description: The role of BFD for this endpoint

transmitInterval.description: The interval between transmitting BFD messages

receiveInterval.description: The interval between receiving BFD messages

ipEncapsulation.description: To report IP settings on the interface

localMultiplier.description: The negotiated transmit interval, multiplied by this value, provides the Detection Time for the receiving system

desiredMinTxInterval.description: Rate at which BFD Control packets are transmitted to the remote system

requiredMinRxInterval.description: Rate at which BFD Control packets arrive from the remote system

sourcePort.description: Source UDP port valid only when IP encapsulation is used

destPort.description: Destination UDP port valid only when IP encapsulation is used

diagnostic.description: A diagnostic code specifying the local system's reason for the last change in session state

mhop.description: True when multihop IP BFD is enabled for BGP on this endpoint

prefixList.description: This stores BGP Afi Safi Prefix List related information.

orf.description: This stores BGP Afi Safi Orf related information.

rrEnabled.description: true/false depending on if nbr is added as route reflector client for afi and safi

nextHopSelf.description: This stores BGP Afi Safi NextHopSelf related information.

configured.description: True when BFD is enabled on this endpoint

profileName.description: The profile name associated with this set of BFD attributes

adminState.description: The administrative state of BFD for this endpoint

operationalState.description: The operational state of BFD for this endpoint

role.description: The role of BFD for this endpoint

transmitInterval.description: The interval between transmitting BFD messages

receiveInterval.description: The interval between receiving BFD messages

mhop.description: True when BFD is enabled on this endpoint

peerOutTotalMessages.description: Total number of peer out messages

peerInUpdateElapsedTime.description: Peer updated elapsed time in seconds

lastError.description: This stores BGP Message Last Error related information.

peerType.description: internal/external depending on peerAs number is same as local or different.

peerAs.description: Autonomous System number configured for the peer.

peerBgpIdentifier.description: BGP identifier of the peer. Learned only in OPEN CONFIRM and ESTABLISHED states.

peerNegotiatedBGPVersion.description: Learned only in OPENCONFIRM and ESTABLISHED states.

peerFsmEstablishedTime.description: Peer Fsm established time in seconds.

bfd.description: Holds BFD attributes for BGP TPE endpoint

transport.description: This package stores BGP transport related information.

timers.description: This package stores BGP time related information.

rr.description: This package stores BGP route reflector related information.

msgs.description: This package stores BGP message related information.

peerClusterId.description: The cluster-id to which peer belongs if it is configured as RR client.

peerConnectRetryInterval.description: Peer connection retry intervel in seconds.

peerNegotiatedHoldTime.description: Peer negotiation hold time in seconds

peerConfiguredHoldTime.description: Peer configured hold time in seconds

peerNegotiatedKeepAliveTime.description: Peer negotiation keep alive time in seconds

peerConfiguredKeepAliveTime.description: Peer configured keep alive time in seconds

peerMinASOriginationInterval.description: Peer minimum AS origination intervel in seconds

peerMinRouteAdvertisementInterval.description: Peer minimum advertised intervel in seconds

localIp.description: If update-source is configured then IP address of the interface. Rely on learned localIp if it is reported. Reported in OPENCONFIRM and ESTABLISHED states.

localPort.description: Local port reported in OPENCONFIRM and ESTABLISHED states.

peerIp.description: Peer Ip configured as part of BGP peer configuration.

peerPort.description: Peer port reported in OPENCONFIRM and ESTABLISHED states.

unit.description: The bandwidth unit that applies to all bandwidth attributes in this package. Available values: bps, kbps, mbps, gbps

used.description: The current used bandwidth by all supported clients

minimum.description: The minimum bandwidth configured for supported clients

maximum.description: The maximum bandwidth configured for supported clients

increment.description: The configured bandwidth increment for auto-sizing of an MPLS tunnel

requested.description: The requested bandwidth from the supporting layer, e.g. a dynamic tunnel requesting bandwidth from IP interface

operational.description: The current bandwidth being allocated from the supporting layer

total.description: The total bandwidth allocated or allowed, e.g. the capacity of an IP interface

bookingFactor.description: The booking factor of how much the bandwidth can be oversubscribed, e.g. on an IP interface

maxReservable.description: The maximum reservable bandwidth allowed to be allocated to supported clients and it's calculated as bwBookingFactor x bwTotal

available.description: The available bandwidth left to be

autoSize.description: If true, the MPLS tunnel will be auto-sized by the NE

autoSizeFailureAction.description: The action to be taken when auto-sizing fails: raise alarm, or make-before-break

autoSizeIntervalMinutes.description: The configured interval between auto-sizing attempts

autoSizeLastResizeState.description: The state of the last auto-sizing attempt

autoSizeLastResizeStartTime.description: Start time of the last auto resize happened

autoSizeLastResizeEndTime.description: End time of the last auto resize happened

autoSizeLastResizeReason.description: Reason of the last auto resize happened

profileName.description: The name of the bandwidth profile associated with the dynamic tunnel endpoint

capacityClass.description: Discrete  b/w space is treated as a list of discrete values; this is default. Continuous  b/w space is treated as continuous segment, in the range of low/upper.

capacity.description: Number of potential client instances or usage instances

capacitySize.description: Identifies how the capacity size is to be interpreted : LIST is a discrete list of values, RANGE is a range in values etc...

capacityCalculationRule.description: Core logic that will be used on capacity calculation

format.description: An optional regex expression or format string describing how to parse the size string in case of multiple values, e.g. CIR:EIR

size.description: Capacity size to be interpreted with CapacityPattern

pattern.description: Identifies how the capacity size is to be interpreted : LIST is a discrete list of values, RANGE is a range in values etc...

cascadedDtlIdTuple.description: This field Cascaded DTL ID Tuple info..

bitmask.description: The 32-bit hexadecimal bitmask of the color

name.description: The name of the color group

bitmask.description: The 32-bit hexadecimal bitmask of the color group

immediateClientPotential.description: If describing connectionRulesInAdaptationLayer: names of TPESpec of immediate client TPE. If describing connectionRulesInOwnLayer: null (not relevant). If describing mustConnectInternally: null (not relevant).

immediateDualPortPeerPotential.description: If describing connectionRulesInAdaptationLayer: names of TPESpec of dual port peer TPE. If describing connectionRulesInOwnLayer: null (not relevant). If describing mustConnectInternally: null (not relevant).

includeRouteObjects.description: List of Route Objects to be included in the route calculation.

excludeRouteObjects.description: List of Route Objects to be excluded from the route calculation.

customerCode.description: Customer Code constraint as applicable for Design Request

diverseObjects.description: Resource to define objects diverse from the route calculation.

coRoutedService.description: Co-routes the service with an existing service.

segmentationRule.description: Whether the segment can be fragmented.

widthRule.description: How wide the range can be. Can point to a specific algorithm to be executed.

lowerBoundaryRule.description: Rule that the boundary of the range must follow. Can point to a specific algorithm to be executed.

upperBoundaryRule.description: Rule that the boundary of the range must follow. Can point to a specific algorithm to be executed.

centerFrequencyRule.description: Rule that the centerFrequency of the range must follow. Can point to a specific algorithm to be executed.

ovpnIds.description: The optical virtual private network ID list

bwThresholdMode.description: The default setting of OSRP link bandwidth threshold mode

commonId.description: Common identifier of the OSRP line

configuredLatencyType.description: Describe whether the latency is discovered or  manual.

isMaster.description: Specifies if this end of the OSRP link is the master.

commState.description: State of the Hello protocol finite state machine.

bwLockOut.description: Specifies if bandwidth lockout is enabled locally for the OSRP line.

codes.description: List of CustomerCode in decreasing order of priority

unorderedList.description: Attribute to specify that code list is unordered.

aliasType.description: The type of this device alias instance.

name.description: The text representation of this device alias.

patternFormat.description: An optional regex pattern for custom alias.

diagnosticStatuses.description: A status list of performance monitoring (PM) and diagnostic tests

diagnostics.description: A list of performance monitoring (PM) and diagnostic tests

existingService.description: The existing service user label list.

rapsVid.description: the R-APS VID of the ring

rplOwner.description: True if the port is configured as RPL-owner.

operationalChannelBlock.description: True if the port is blocked, i.e portState == Blocked

sharedPort.description: sharedPort information for the sub-ring (ONLY for sub-ring endNode)

sharedPortRef.description: the ID of the PTP on the shared port

forceSwitch.description: a flag indicating whether the switching is forced or not.

subRingTermination.description: flag indicating whether the subring is terminating or not

waitToRestore.description: wait to restore time in minute.

waitToBlock.description: wait to block time in milliseconds.

ringMembers.description: a comma separated list of virtual ring members.

hopAddress.description: The IP-data interface address for this hop

bfd.description: Holds BFD attributes for TPE endpoint

levelType.description: Level of an IS-IS node - can be level-1, level-2 or level-1-2

linkCost.description: Cost associated with the links having range 1-63, i.e. default-10, delay, expense etc.

lfaCandidateEnable.description: Enable/disable the interface from being used as LFA for level-1, level-2 or level-1-2 primary route

termination.description: The specification of the layer protocol termination (including framing, modulation etc). For example the specification of the function that takes a MAC frame and extracts the content (removing the MAC address in the process).

layerRateQualifier.description: Provides a means to provide additional qualification attributes for a Layer Rate. For example, for beyond 100G rates OTUCn and ODUCn, the value of n, where n is a multiple of 100. For example, for beyond 100G rates with sub rate potential (i.e. OTUCn-M), this includes the n-M options where n is the number of OxUC overhead instances and M is the number of 5G tributary slots. For example, OTUC4-60 implies 4 instances of OxUC overhead, and 300G capacity (5G x 60).

structureType.description: Identifies the internal structure of the layer termination.

terminationState.description: Whether and how this LayerTermination is terminated.

adminState.description: The administrative state of the layer termination.

operationalState.description: The operational (actual) state of the layer termination.

active.description: Whether or not an inactive layer appears to be absent from the layer stack.

adjacencyPackage.description: This package stores layer adjacency information.

retainedAdjacencyPackage.description: This package stores layer adjacency information.

manualAdjacencyPackage.description: This package stores layer adjacency information.

powerPackage.description: This package stores power related information.

photonicSpectrumPackage.description: This package stores photonic spectrum information.

cfmPackages.description: Holds data related to CFM services configured on an Ethernet service

mplsPackage.description: This package stores MPLS tunnel information.

g8032Package.description: This package stores information about the G8032 ring

signalIndex.description: Attribute representing a signal index (e.g. channel information, wavelength, etc).

nativeName.description: The name of the TPE that is native to the network element.

layerProtocol.description: A LayerProtocol instance is used for controlling termination and monitoring functionality. Also, it is used for controlling the adaptation (i.e. encapsulation and/or multiplexing of client signal), tandem connection monitoring, traffic conditioning and/or shaping functionality at an intermediate point along a connection.

trafficProfiles.description: Traffic profile characteristics used to data-drive provisioning workflows.

boundaries.description: Array of strings to track boundaries of Layer Termination

controlPlanePackage.description: The northbound model of Control Plane Package.

resiliencyTopologyPackage.description: This package stores resiliency topology information.

adminWt.description: Administrative weight which specifies the level of importance given to the OSRP link

bundleIds.description: List of up to 20 protection bundles to which the OSRP link belongs

additionalAttributes.description: Various miscellaneous attributes that do not necessarily belong in the parent resource. Attributes are populated dynamically and therefore cannot be documented here.

ipInterfacePackage.description: To report IP settings on the interface

additionalAttributes.description: Various miscellaneous attributes that do not necessarily belong in the parent resource. Attributes are populated dynamically and therefore cannot be documented here.

autoCreatedByNetwork.description: Indicates if the entity is auto created by the network and/or device (true) or must it explicitly be created (false).

autoDeletedByNetwork.description: Indicates if the entity is auto deleted by the network and/or device (true) or must it explicitly be created (false).

tags.description: Reference to 3rd Party Network involved in this topology, can be re-used for other purposes in future.

description.description: Short description of the topology to be created.

userLabel.description: The user label (not necessarily unique) of the topology to be created.

mgmtAccess.description: The management access used to specify or discover the location.

address.description: The location is comprised of one or more address datums. For example, many cards are identified with with both a shelf and a slot address.

key.description: The type of the address location.

value.description: int or character value as appropriate to the associated entity and field.

pattern.description: optional regex or delimiter value to parse multi-valued subslot string.

loopbackStatus.description: Status of the test; taken directly from the value of the TL1 LPBKSTATUS field.

loopbackWavelength.description: Wavelength of the loopback test; taken directly from the value of the TL1 LPBKWVL field

tribSlots.description: Mapped tributary slots corresponding to tributary port

direction.description: The directionality defined in terms of RX/TX.

startTime.description: Start time of the make-before-break happened

endTime.description: End time of the make-before-break happened

mepAdminState.description: The administrative state (enabled/disabled) of the MEP

mepType.description: The type of the MEP, up or down

mepMacAddress.description: The MAC address of the MEP

vlanId.description: The VLAN ID of the MEP

lmm.description: Holds Y.1731 attributes for one measurement type of a MEP

dmm.description: Holds Y.1731 attributes for one measurement type of a MEP

slm.description: Holds Y.1731 attributes for one measurement type of a MEP

remoteMepId.description: The ID of the remote MEP

frrAutoCreated.description: The flag indicating whether the FB tunnel is auto created by FRR

protectedInterface.description: Name of the interface being protected by the FB tunnel

excludeIp.description: IP address excluded from the FB tunnel path

name.description: Name of the tunnel protected by this FB tunnel

srcIp.description: Source IP address of the tunnel protected by this FB tunnel

destIp.description: Destination IP address of the tunnel protected by this FB tunnel

role.description: The role at this point of the MPLS tunnel protected by this FB tunnel

frrProtected.description: If true, the tunnel is protected by fast re-route (FRR) on the headend TX MPLS CTP

profileName.description: The FRR profile name on the headend TX MPLS CTP

localProtection.description: Holds MPLS FRR local protection attributes for TX MPLS CTP

actualProtectionRoute.description: Actual FRR protection route on the headend TX MPLS CTP

protectionAvailable.description: True when the protection is available on this endpoint

protectionInUse.description: True when the protection is in use on this endpoint

ip.description: IP interface address or node loopback IP address of the current hop

protectionType.description: The FB protection type on this hop for this unidirectional tunnel

protectionInUse.description: True when the protection is in use on this endpoint

bwProtected.description: True when the bandwidth is protected on this endpoint

lspName.description: The name of this MPLS tunnel

lspId.description: The numeric ID of this MPLS tunnel

coRouted.description: If true, this MPLS tunnel is co-routed; otherwise it is associated

signaled.description: If true, this MPLS tunnel is dynamic; otherwise it is static

subType.description: TP refers to Transport Profile; TE refers to Traffic Engineering

direction.description: Tunnel direction. Use value bidirectional or unidirectional only and TPE attribute stackDirection since ingress and egress are ambiguous

ctrlPlaneId.description: A generated value to uniquely identify a particular tunnel instance

srcIp.description: The IP-data interface address of the near end of this MPLS tunnel

srcTunnelId.description: The ID of the near end of this MPLS tunnel

destIp.description: The IP-data interface address of the far end of this MPLS tunnel

destTunnelId.description: The ID of the far end of this MPLS tunnel

fwdIn.description: The inward ID in the forward direction (transit)

fwdOut.description: The outward ID in the forward direction (transit)

revIn.description: The inward ID in the reverse direction (transit)

revOut.description: The outward ID in the reverse direction (transit)

prevHopIp.description: The interface address (on 6200, MAC address) of the previous hop of this MPLS tunnel

nextHopIp.description: The interface address (on 6200, MAC address) of the next hop of this MPLS tunnel

prevHopIfNum.description: The interface number of the previous hop of this MPLS tunnel

nextHopIfNum.description: The interface number of the next hop of this MPLS tunnel

localIfNamePrevHop.description: The local interface name of the previous hop of this MPLS tunnel (6200 only)

localIfNameNextHop.description: The local interface name of the next hop of this MPLS tunnel (6200 only)

RxTag.description: The label used for traffic ingressing to this endpoint

TxTag.description: The label used for traffic egressing from this endpoint

tunnelRole.description: The role at this point in the MPLS tunnel

bw.description: Holds bandwidth attributes for a dynamic tunnel endpoint or an IP interface

autoBackup.description: A flag to signal if auto-backup tunnel creation is on or off

diversityResource.description: The object upon which to base diversity for the backup tunnel

diversityLevel.description: The diversity level of backup tunnel creation (maximal meaning best-effort)

explicitRouteObject.description: An ordered list of hop-by-hop IP-data interface addresses traversed by this dynamic MPLS tunnel

bfd.description: Holds BFD attributes for one LER TPE endpoint

aisProfileName.description: The name of the Alarm Indication Signal profile for this MPLS tunnel

aisSessionAdminState.description: The administrative state of the AIS session for this MPLS tunnel

aisRefreshTimer.description: The interval between each AIS refresh for this MPLS tunnel

frrSignaling.description: Deprecated by frr package and will be removed later. Flag for fast re-route capability

frrProfile.description: Deprecated by frr package and will be removed later. The fast re-route profile for this MPLS tunnel

explicitTunnel.description: Holds data for the explicit tunnel path

setupPriority.description: The priority of the dynamic tunnel setup (0-7)

holdPriority.description: The priority of the dynamic tunnel steady-state (0-7)

optimization.description: A flag indicating if tunnel optimization should be attempted by the control-plane

optimizationInterval.description: The interval between tunnel optimization attempts

srlg.description: A list of shared-risk link-group values assigned to this interface

colorGroup.description: The color group for a dynamic tunnel endpoint

includeAny.description: The color group for a dynamic tunnel endpoint

includeAll.description: The color group for a dynamic tunnel endpoint

excludeAny.description: The color group for a dynamic tunnel endpoint

facilityBypass.description: If true, this MPLS tunnel is facility-bypass (FB) tunnel

softPreemption.description: If true, soft preemption is enabled. Applicable to dynamic TE unidirectional tunnels only.

stickyLsp.description: A flag indicating a dynamic tunnel stays on the same path after change in required resources. Applicable to dynamic coRouted tunnels only.

shareSrlg.description: A list of share SRLG values used by dynamic tunnel during provisioning.

errorSubCode.description: Sub error code for last error

noOfUnits.description: Number 1-80 in switching and broadband case

name.description: The name/tid of the Network Element (e.g. OTTAWA_001).

siteName.description: The site name of the NE. May be a CLLI or some other customer defined format.

planningId.description: The opaque id provided by a planning tool interacting with IFD.

noteMsg.description: The message left on the note left by the user

lastUpdatedBy.description: The name of the user that last edited the note

lastUpdatedTime.description: The time the note was last updated

minFreqDeadBand.description: Lower dead band in GHz. The dead band will be in format of 'xxxx.xxx'.

maxFreqDeadBand.description: Upper dead band in GHz. The dead band will be in format of 'xxxx.xxx'.

targetMinFreq.description: Allows the automatic adjustment of the MINFREQ when any associated NMCTP are deleted. Default is MINFREQ (no target lower frequency).

targetMaxFreq.description: Allows the automatic adjustment of the MAXFREQ when any associated NMCTP are deleted. Default is MAXFREQ (no target upper frequency).

minFreqGuardBand.description: Indicates the minimum required frequency spacing for the previous NMC.

maxFreqGuardBand.description: Indicates the minimum required frequency spacing for the next NMC.

freqResolution.description: Indicates the recurring frequency step that is allowed to be configured on the transponder.

signalBandWidth10DB.description: Captures Tx Signal Bandwidth in GHz measured at 10 dBm less than peak power.

signalBandWidth3DB.description: Captures Tx Signal Bandwidth in GHz measured at 3 dBm less than peak power.

wavelengthGrid.description: A hexadecimal number representing the vector of wavelengths that can be used by this SNC. Each bit set within the number indicates which wavelength is currently configured

regenTid.description: This field is the Regen ID Tid

nearTransponder.description: This field is near Transponder Shelf SLot Port.

clientTransponder.description: The Client Transponder Shelf SLot Port

mateInfo.description: This field is Mate Info String.

type.description: The route type i.e. photonic. In the future, other types may be supported.

numberOfRoutes.description: Number of routes defined by the configuration. For example, a PRIME/MEMBER configuration.  Could be a number, or could be a number evident from the model i.e. inverseMux. Generally, should only be specified if the configuration implies more than 1 route.

sizeOfEachRoute.description: For each route, what is the required size of each route. For example, '200G' in the case of 400G WLAi OTR 2xOTSi.

maxInCpGroup.description: Maximum number of routes that can be present in a control plane group. Could be a number, or could be a number evident n the model i.e. inverseMux.

routeCharacteristic.description: If multiple routes need to be defined, what's the relationship between the routes.

signalPattern.description: If photonic route type, specifies the frequency or wavelength pattern to choose for the routes.

routeObjectType.description: The attribute defining the route type.

terminationPointName.description: Specifies the location of an endpoint.

roadmLineName.description: The ROADM Line Name. The routeObjectType attribute must be set to ROADM_LINE_NAME.

nodeName.description: The Node/ROADM/Network Construct Name. The routeObjectType attribute must be set to NODE_NAME.

siteName.description: The Site Name. The routeObjectType attribute must be set to SITE_NAME.

controlPlane.description: Technology layer of the control plane.

frequency.description: L0 frequency. The routeObjectType attribute must be set to FREQUENCY.

sncg.description: SNCG id. The routeObjectType attribute must be set to SNCG.

snc.description: SNC id. The routeObjectType attribute must be set to SNC.

aliasType.description:
CLFI - Common Language Facility code
DISTINGUISHED_NAME - Distinguished Alias Name
MANAGEMENT_NAME - the CESD VS name

name.description: The free string name value associated with selected aliasType.

networkElement.description: Data associated with a particular network element.

eqptGrp.description: The node Equipment Group location identifier

lspName.description: The name of the label switch path ids(unique) of the service to be created and activated

pseudoWireId.description: The name of the pseudoWireId(unique) of the MPLS service to be created and activated

tunnelRole.description: Role of the MPLS tunnel headEnd or tailEnd

protectionRole.description: Role of the MPLS protection primary or backup

layerTerminations.description: Transmission parameters to be provisioned on TPE layer terminations.

interfaceType.description: Convenient instruction to identify the endpoint role.

data.description: Resource to specify intent to design and fulfill one service.

turnUpDateTime.description: The optional time when the service is to be activated. If omitted the service shall be activated immediately (now).

turnDownDateTime.description: The optional time when the service is to be de-activated. If omitted the service shall remain activated until explicit deletion.

aliasNames.description: One or more alias names that identify the service to be created and activated.

label.description: The user label (not necessarily unique) of the service to be created and activated.

directionality.description: Indicates if the FRE is unidirectional or bidirectional.

evcPortType.description: Convenient instruction about handling endpoint data (e.g. ETHERNET differentiates EPL from EVPL via CVID).

endPoints.description: All the endpoints involved in the definition of the service. Two instances must always be defined based on supported service type.

constraints.description: Set of various constraints used to configure the service intent.

attributes.description: Attributes of the Service Intent Request. All supported services are PointToPoint at this time.

data.description: The Service Intent Response data resource.
Array containing all Service Intent Response Data obtained from the request.

creationTime.description: The time at which the service intent was created.

intentState.description: The current state of the service intent.

request.description: Resource to specify intent to design and fulfill one service.

discovered.description: True if the Service Intent was discovered/promoted from the network.

id.description: The unique identifier of the service intent.

type.description: The type of the service intent.

attributes.description: Attributes of the Service Intent Response.
Attributes of the Service Intent Route.

aPoint.description: Specifies the location of a link endpoint.

zPoint.description: Specifies the location of a link endpoint.

directionality.description: Describes the directionality of the routes traffic flow.

networkElementName.description: Identification of the node using its natural name from the NE NBI protocol (e.g. TID for TL1, sysName for SAOS).

data.description: The Service Intent Routes Data Resource.

attributes.description: Resource containing information pertaining to the routes of the Service Intent.

index.description: The signal index. Indicates a time slot.

odu2_index.description: The odu2 index. Indicates a time slot or tributary port number.

odu3_index.description: The odu3 index. Indicates a time slot or tributary port number.

odu4_index.description: The odu4 index. Indicates a time slot or tributary port number.

oduCn_index.description: The oduCn index. Indicates a time slot or tributary port number.

indexes.description: Map of index attributes to represent more than one indexes per LT. Plan is to remove above odu2_index, odu4_index & oduCn_index signal attributes in future and use this one

channels.description: Indicates the list of discrete channels utilized e.g. tributary slots on broadband cards. Plans are to utilize this generically for any list of discrete list of signals.

ots_index.description: The ots index. Indicates a time slot.

phy_index.description: The physical index. Indicates a time slot.

mgmtMcId.description: The management identifier of the media channel

nativeName.description: The name of the TCM TPE that is native to the network element.

userLabel.description: The label given to the TCM TPE by an user

owner.description: Identifies who created the TCM facility

mode.description: Identifies the mode of the TCM

additionalAttributes.description: Various miscellaneous attributes that do not necessarily belong in the parent resource. Attributes are populated dynamically and therefore cannot be documented here.

location.description: A location object describes the location an entity in the network (Equipment, FRE, TPE, etc.). The amount of address data required to precisely reflect the position of an entity in the network is dependent on the entity in question (i.e. TPEs typically require more information then equipment). Location is typically used in conjunction with a network element identifier to uniquely identify position within a network.

cfmServiceName.description: The name of the CFM service

mep.description: Each entry holds information about one Maintenance Endpoint configured on this TPE

inputParams.description: List of input parameters to be matched to derive the correct trafficProfile for the use-case.

trafficParams.description: List of traffic parameters that must be used as input in the use-case.

routeConstraints.description: Defines the traffic profile route characteristics used to data-drive provisioning workflows.

outputs.description: List of outputs that are expected in the use-case.

selectFrom.description: Alternate form of value attribute that permits a comma separated list of the choices available for selection.

location.description: If an input, where to find the attribute. If an output, where to set the attribute.

ttiTx.description: This package stores tti Attribute information.

ttiRx.description: This package stores tti Attribute information.

ttiExpectedRx.description: This package stores tti Attribute information.

pathName.description: The name of this explicit tunnel path

enabled.description: True when the particular measurement is enabled

interval.description: The interval between transmitting each message (e.g.: 1)

intervalUnit.description: The unit of interval between transmitting each message (e.g.: seconds)

priority.description: The priority of the messages being transmitted (0-7)

frameSize.description: The frame size of the messages being transmitted (numeric), if applicable to this measurement

repeatDelay.description: The repeat delay of the message being transmitted

count.description: The count of the message being transmitted

iterate.description: The iteration number of the message being transmitted

remoteMepId.description: The ID of the remote MEP

remoteMepMacAddress.description: The MAC address of the remote MEP
